summary: An FBI New York Intelligence Division Tactical Intelligence Report dated 21 March 2022, summarizing research on a suspected defense witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The report details the individual's employment history with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, her associated addresses linked to Epstein properties, and identifies investigative gaps regarding her knowledge of victims and illicit activities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a child sex trafficking investigation and trial. Identified as the office manager at Epstein's company and co-accused with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier accused of sexually abusing victims with Ghislaine Maxwell. Employer of the person of interest and owner of properties associated with her addresses.

persons.name: Healy
persons.context: Mentioned as another witness whose interview could reveal more information about the relationship between Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Co-accused in a child sex trafficking investigation based on information regarding several victims reportedly sexually abused by both.
Maxwell was understood to be the office manager at Epstein's company.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Begins
events.description: Trial started for Ghislaine Maxwell on child sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Defense Witness List Received
events.description: FBI New York Criminal Division squad C-20 received a potential list of defense witnesses for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Person of Interest Hired
events.description: The person of interest was hired as a receptionist at Epstein's company.

events.title: Epstein Property Transaction
events.description: The person of interest was listed as a witness on a Jeffrey Epstein property transaction.

locations: 457 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10022 (Epstein's New York office)
keyFacts: The FBI was researching a suspected defense witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial to identify the individual and any derogatory information.
The person of interest was employed by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, working as a receptionist at Epstein's New York office.
The person of interest had three prior residential addresses associated with Jeffrey Epstein: his office, his private island, and his New York residence.
Investigative gaps include determining the extent of the person's awareness of Maxwell's illicit activities and her knowledge of victims in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The research was based on FBI interviews and open-source information collected between October and December 2021.
